actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 102-887.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 504.
Mr. Waxman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: To provide for a 3-year extension of a certain medicaid health maintenance organization waiver.

summary.text: Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to waive the application to the District of Columbia Chartered Health Plan, Inc., of the requirement under the Social Security Act that Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries (or persons eligible for Medicare or Medicaid) constitute less than 75 percent of the membership of a participating health maintenance organization, for the period beginning October 1, 1992, and ending January 31, 1994, if the Secretary determines that such entity is making continuous efforts and progress toward achieving compliance with such requirement.

titles.title: To provide for a 3-year extension of a certain medicaid health maintenance organization waiver.
